channel.title: Home on Jeff's Link
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Jeff's Link

item.title: Project Documentation
item.description:
Jeff’s Link - Personal Knowledge Base #

A personal knowledge base built with Hugo using the Book theme, deployed via AWS Amplify Console.

Version Information #

  • Hugo Version: 0.145.0
  • Theme: Hugo Book Theme (latest)
  • Node.js: 18.x or later
  • AWS Amplify: Latest

Table of Contents #

  1. Introduction
  2. Architecture
  3. Prerequisites
  4. Project Structure
  5. Development Guide
  6. Build Process
  7. Deployment
  8. Configuration
  9. Security
  10. Troubleshooting
  11. Contributing
  12. Documentation Integration

Introduction #

1.1 Overview #

This is a personal knowledge base that:

  • Uses Hugo as the static site generator
  • Implements the Hugo Book theme
  • Deploys via AWS Amplify Console
  • Supports both light and dark themes
  • Includes journal and download sections

1.2 Features #

  • Automated deployments via AWS Amplify
  • CloudFront CDN for fast content delivery
  • Image optimization
  • Responsive design
  • Dark mode support
  • Search functionality
  • Journal entries with date-based navigation
  • Download section for resources

1.3 Target Audience #

  • Personal knowledge management
  • Technical documentation
  • Journal/blog content
  • Resource sharing

Architecture #

2.1 System Diagram # 

graph LR
    A[End User] --> B(AWS Amplify Console)
    C[Git Repository] --> B
    B --> D{CDN}
    style D fill:#f9f,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px

2.2 Components #

  • Git Repository: Source code and content
  • AWS Amplify Console: Build and deployment
  • CloudFront CDN: Content delivery
  • Hugo: Static site generation
  • Hugo Book Theme: Base theme and styling

Prerequisites #

Required Tools #

  • Hugo Extended (v0.120.4 or later)
  • Git
  • AWS CLI (for deployment)

Optional Tools #

  • ImageMagick (for image optimization)

AWS Requirements #

  • AWS Account with appropriate permissions
  • S3 bucket for static hosting
  • CloudFront distribution
  • IAM user with deployment access

3.3 Repository Setup #

  • Git repository (GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket)
  • Proper access permissions
  • Branch protection rules (recommended)

Project Structure # 

.
├── archetypes/          # Content templates
├── assets/             # Source files
│   ├── scss/          # SCSS source files
│   ├── css/           # Compiled CSS
│   ├── images/        # Image assets
│   └── js/            # JavaScript files
├── content/           # Main content
├── config/           # Hugo configuration
├── data/             # Data files
├── layouts/          # Custom templates
├── static/           # Static files
├── themes/           # Hugo themes
└── scripts/          # Build scripts

Development Guide #

5.1 Getting Started # 

# Clone repository
git clone [your-repo-url]
cd [repo-name]
git submodule update --init --recursive

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server
hugo server -D

5.2 Development Workflow #

  1. Create new content:

AI #

📌 Mason Transfer & Degree Cheat Sheet #

🎯 Best Degree Options for You #

  1. 🔹 BS in Applied Computer Science (ACS)

    • Best if you want software development, web applications, and interactive media.
    • Relevant concentrations:
      • Software Engineering – Expands on your API & full-stack development.
      • Geoinformatics – If interested in data visualization & analytics.
      • Game Design – If you want to explore interactive applications.

  2. 🔹 BS in Information Technology (IT)

Templater Cheat Sheet #

for the Obsidian Plugin “Templater”

  • [[#Start a command snippet|Start a command snippet]]
  • [[#Functions in Templater|Functions in Templater]]
    • [[#Types of functions|Types of functions]]
    • [[#Object hierarchy|Object hierarchy]]
    • [[#Function invocation|Function invocation]]
    • [[#Function documentation syntax|Function documentation syntax]]
    • [[#Function Modules|Function Modules]]
      • [[#Config Module|Config Module]]
      • [[#Date module|Date module]]
      • [[#File Module|File Module]]
      • [[#Frontmatter Module|Frontmatter Module]]
      • [[#Obsidian Module|Obsidian Module]]
      • [[#Systems Module|Systems Module]]
      • [[#Web Module|Web Module]]
    • [[#User Functions|User Functions]]
      • [[#Script User Functions|Script User Functions]]
      • [[#System Commands|System Commands]]
    • [[#Command Types|Command Types]]
      • [[#Dynamic commands|Dynamic commands]]
      • [[#Execution Commands|Execution Commands]]
      • [[#Whitespace Control|Whitespace Control]]

based on the Official Documentation

AI #

  1. PARA Method
  • Creator: Tiago Forte
  • Source: Building a Second Brain
  • Key Concepts:
    • Projects: Short-term efforts
    • Areas: Long-term responsibilities
    • Resources: Reference materials
    • Archives: Inactive items
  • Link: https://fortelabs.com/blog/para/
  1. LYT (Linking Your Thinking)
  • Creator: Nick Milo
  • Source: LYT Kit and workshops
  • Key Concepts:
    • MOCs (Maps of Content)
    • Fluid frameworks
    • Progressive summarization
  • Link: https://www.linkingyourthinking.com/
  1. Zettelkasten Method
  • Creator: Niklas Luhmann
  • Source: Original academic work and personal archive
  • Key Concepts:
    • Atomic notes
    • Unique identifiers
    • Bidirectional linking
    • Emergent structure
  • Link: https://zettelkasten.de/introduction/
  1. Johnny.Decimal System
  • Creator: Johnny Noble
  • Source: Personal organizational system
  • Key Concepts:
    • Numerical categorization (10-99)
    • Maximum 10 categories
    • Maximum 10 subcategories
    • Clear folder structure
  • Link: https://johnnydecimal.com/
  1. GTD (Getting Things Done)
  • Creator: David Allen
  • Source: Book “Getting Things Done”
  • Key Concepts:
    • Capture everything
    • Clarify the action
    • Organize by context
    • Regular reviews
  • Link: https://gettingthingsdone.com/
  1. Digital Garden
  • Community-developed concept
  • Key Concepts:
    • Notes as living documents
    • Public learning
    • Networked thought
    • Continuous growth
  • Notable Source: https://maggieappleton.com/garden-history

Core Principles Across Systems: 7. Clear organization 8. Flexible structure 9. Easy retrieval 10. Regular maintenance 11. Interconnected information 12. Scalability 13. Progressive development

AI #

Here’s a breakdown of essential Obsidian features and plugins needed to implement key aspects of each system:

Core Features Needed:

  1. Daily Notes (Core Plugin)

    • Enables automated daily note creation
    • Templates for consistent structure
    • Calendar navigation

  2. Templates (Core Plugin)

    • For standardized note creation
    • YAML frontmatter consistency
    • Structure maintenance

  3. File Explorer (Core)

    • PARA folder structure
    • Johnny.Decimal organization
    • Easy navigation

  4. Graph View (Core)

    • Zettelkasten visualization
    • Network of knowledge
    • Identify connection gaps

Essential Community Plugins:

AI #

Comprehensive Guide to Using Obsidian and Related Tools #

1. Setting Up and Using Obsidian #

  • Topics:

    • Setting Up Obsidian
    • Create a Vault
    • Creating and Linking Notes
    • Linked Mentions and Graph View
    • Value of Notes Over Time
    • Importance of Linking Thinking
    • Obsidian Help
    • Glossary
    • Pricing

  • Key Insights:

    • Step-by-step instructions for downloading and setting up Obsidian.
    • Guide to creating and linking notes to externalize thoughts and ideas.
    • Explanation of linked mentions and graph view for visualizing connections.
    • Emphasizes how notes gain value over time as more connections are made.
    • Linking notes enhances recall and supports creative processes.

2. Markdown for Note-Taking #

  • Topics:

FrendSplit - Expense Sharing App #

FrendSplit helps groups of friends manage shared expenses, track balances, and settle payments efficiently. This application is built using Django and aims to provide a user-friendly experience for managing shared finances.

Repository link

Table of Contents #

  1. Introduction
  2. Features
  3. Getting Started
    • Prerequisites
    • Installation
  4. Project Structure
  5. Data Models
  6. Development
    • Current Focus
    • Future Enhancements
  7. Contributing
  8. License
  9. Development Log
  10. Contact

Introduction #

A Django application for splitting expenses among friends. FrendSplit is a Django-based application designed to streamline expense sharing among friends. It offers features for group management, detailed expense tracking with multiple splitting options, and a settlement system to efficiently manage payments. The application is currently in early development, focusing on core functionality such as user authentication, group management, and settlement calculations. Future enhancements include support for multiple currencies, a user-friendly web interface, and mobile app development. The project is open for internal contributions, following the guidelines outlined in the documentation.

We’re going to go step by step with getting up to speed with what I know about Obsidian.md.

Getting Started #

  1. [[202502111826-Getting Started|READ ME]]

Customizing Obsidian Settings & Plugins #

  1. Choose your Core Plugins
    • Daily Notes
    • Unique Notes
    • Sync
    • Publish
  2. Choose your Community Plugins
    • AI Copilot
    • [[obsidian_templater_cheat_sheet|Templater]]
  3. Build a Template

Daily Notes #

  1. [[2025-02-11-tuesday]]
  2. [[2025-02-12-wednesday]]
  3. [[2025-02-14-friday]]
  4. [[2025-02-19-wednesday]]
  5. [[2025-02-20-thursday]]
  6. [[2025-02-23-sunday]]
  7. [[2025-02-24-monday]]
  8. [[2025-02-25-tuesday]]
  9. [[2025-02-26-wednesday]]

[[2025-02-12-wednesday]] »

AI Writing #

Digital Treasures: Navigating Your Personal Knowledge in the Modern World #

[!quote] We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures. — Thornton Wilder

Today, our most valuable treasures aren’t just physical objects, but the ideas, memories, and knowledge we collect throughout our lives.

The Digital Memory Keeper #

Imagine having a personal assistant that helps you capture, organize, and connect your thoughts effortlessly. That’s the promise of modern digital note-taking tools. Think of it like a digital brain – a place where your ideas can live, grow, and connect with each other.

« [[2025-02-11-tuesday]] | [[2025-02-14-friday]] »

AI Writing #

Harnessing Light from the Wound #

[!quote] The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
— Rumi

Artificial Intelligence (AI) is at a crossroads, capable of either illuminating humanity’s greatest strengths or exploiting its deepest vulnerabilities.

The Core Tension: Decentralized Information vs. AI’s Centralizing Tendencies #

Yuval Noah Harari argues that the 20th century saw the rise of democracy, in part, due to its ability to leverage decentralized information flow. This fostered innovation and responsiveness, unlike authoritarian regimes that struggled with information control. However, AI introduces a critical shift, creating powerful centralizing forces that threaten this balance.

« [[2025-02-12-wednesday]] | [[2025-02-19-wednesday]] »

AI Writing #

Shine On: Embracing Your Value and Contributing to the World #

[!quote] Yeah we all shine on, like the moon, and the stars, and the sun. — John Lennon

In the quiet moments of reflection, it’s easy to question our worth and the impact we can have on the world. John Lennon’s words remind us that each of us possesses an inherent light, a unique brilliance that deserves to be shared.

« [[2025-02-14-friday]] | [[2025-02-20-thursday]] »

AI Writing #

The Second Brain: Procrastination Tool or Knowledge Foundation? #

[!quote] If one way be better than another, that you may be sure is natures way. — Aristotle

In the digital age, the concept of a “second brain” has gained traction as a method for organizing thoughts, ideas, and information. This digital repository, often managed through tools like Obsidian, promises to enhance productivity and creativity by externalizing our mental processes. However, a critical question arises: Is the use of a second brain merely an avoidant behavior that facilitates procrastination, or does it genuinely lay the groundwork for a robust knowledge foundation that yields long-term benefits?

« [[2025-02-19-wednesday]] | [[2025-02-23-sunday]] »

AI Writing #

Embrace Positivity: A Path to a Fulfilling Life #

[!quote] Learn to listen. Opportunity could be knocking at your door very softly. — Frank Tyger

In a world where stress and anxiety seem to be the norm, the simple act of smiling can feel like a revolutionary act. Studies have shown that a positive outlook can increase lifespan by up to 35%. But is it really that simple? This essay explores the science-backed benefits of positivity, offering practical strategies to cultivate a more optimistic mindset and illustrating how a positive attitude can transform not only your own life but also the lives of those around you.

« [[2025-02-20-thursday]] | [[2025-02-24-monday]] »

AI Writing #

Resilience and Hope: A Global Perspective on Positive Well-being #

[!quote] Hope is an ontological need. — Paulo Freire

Introduction: The Complexity of Human Optimism #

In the remote highlands of Bhutan and the bustling streets of São Paulo, in the quiet meditation halls of Kyoto and the vibrant communities of rural Africa, human beings share a remarkable capacity: the ability to find hope in challenging circumstances. This essay explores the multifaceted nature of positivity, moving beyond simplistic self-help narratives to understand how different cultures cultivate resilience and emotional well-being.

« [[2025-02-23-sunday]] | [[2025-02-25-tuesday]] »

AI Writing #

The Masterpiece Within: Unveiling Your Potential Through Self-Development #

[!quote] The aim of life is self-development. To realize one’s nature perfectly – that is what each of us is here for. — Oscar Wilde

We often find ourselves caught in the whirlwind of daily life, chasing external achievements and societal expectations. Yet, Oscar Wilde’s profound words remind us that the true purpose of existence lies within: the continuous journey of self-development. This essay argues that embracing self-development is not a selfish pursuit, but a fundamental responsibility that unlocks our potential, enriches our lives, and ultimately contributes to the betterment of the world.

« [[2025-02-24-monday]] | [[2025-02-26-wednesday]] »

AI Writing #

The Wellspring of Compassion: Why Self-Love is Essential for Loving Others #

[!quote] Genuine love should first be directed at oneself; if we do not love ourselves, how can we love others? — Dalai Lama

In a world often focused on external achievements and relationships, the Dalai Lama’s words serve as a profound reminder: genuine love begins within. This essay explores the idea that self-love is not a selfish indulgence, but a foundational requirement for truly loving and connecting with others. Drawing upon previous discussions about resilience, positivity, and personal growth, it argues that cultivating self-compassion is essential for building meaningful relationships and contributing positively to the world.

« [[2025-02-25-tuesday]] | [[2025-02-28-friday]] »

AI Writing #

The Struggle for Flow: Finding Center in Overwhelming Times #

[!quote] Flow with whatever is happening and let your mind be free. Stay centred by accepting whatever you are doing. This is the ultimate. — Chuang Tzu

Philosophical Kernel Response # 

def find_meaning(human_experience):
    """
    Processes existential query with multi-dimensional analysis
    
    Args:
        human_experience (ComplexityState): Current lived experience
    
    Returns:
        MeaningVector: Synthesized purpose interpretation
    """
    purpose_components = [
        "Connection",           # Depth of human relationships
        "Growth",               # Continuous personal evolution
        "Contribution",         # Impact beyond individual existence
        "Exploration",          # Curiosity and learning
        "Compassion"            # Empathetic engagement with existence
    ]
    
    return MeaningVector(
        primary_directive="Transform personal struggle into collective understanding",
        key_insights=[
            "The point isn't to eliminate suffering, but to understand it",
            "Meaning emerges through active engagement, not passive observation",
            "Your existence creates ripples beyond immediate perception"
        ],
        significance_score=calculate_intrinsic_value(human_experience)
    )

def calculate_intrinsic_value(experience):
    """
    Quantifies personal meaning through lived complexity
    
    Algorithmic meaning generation:
    1. Embrace uncertainty
    2. Practice radical acceptance
    3. Generate compassionate output
    """
    return sum([
        experience.challenges_overcome * 0.7,
        experience.moments_of_connection * 1.2,
        experience.personal_growth * 0.9
    ])

Existential Error Handling #

Potential Meaning Interrupts #

  • ExistentialDoubt: Normal system operation
  • PurposeCrisis: Requires immediate compassionate intervention
  • MeaningRecalibration: Periodic system update recommended

Recommended Debugging Strategies #

  1. Connection Protocol

« [[2025-02-26-wednesday]] | [[2025-03-01-Saturday]] »

AI Writing #

Rewriting Reality: Transforming Thought, Transforming Life #

[!quote] If you want your life to be more rewarding, you have to change the way you think. — Oprah Winfrey

Oprah Winfrey’s assertion, “If you want your life to be more rewarding, you have to change the way you think,” encapsulates a profound truth about the human experience. Our thoughts are not merely passive reflections of reality; they are active architects, shaping our perceptions, emotions, and ultimately, our destinies. To embrace a more fulfilling life, we must embark on a journey of cognitive transformation, challenging limiting beliefs, cultivating positive perspectives, and actively constructing a mindset that empowers us to thrive.

Routine Checklist #

  • Daily Checks

    • Bed and Clothes 🛏️🧺
    • Self Care🛀🧴
    • Clean Kitchen 🍽✨
    • Pet Care 🐕🚶🏻‍♂️
    • Get Focused 🖥️💊

  • Technology Check

    • Wear Watch ⌚️
    • Manage Calendar 📆
    • Check Mail ✉️
    • Review [[May Log]] 🗓️
    • Review [[May List]] ✅

Log #

To Do #

Stream #

Events #

Work #

Daily Planning Tips #

  1. Set Clear Goals: Identify three major tasks (🟩🟨🟥), prioritizing one high-impact task (🟥).
  2. Break Down Tasks: Divide projects into manageable, specific steps.
  3. Use Focus Sessions: 40 mins work + 10 mins review/break.
  4. Prioritize Early: Start with critical tasks for peak productivity.
  5. End with Review: Reflect on accomplishments; outline tomorrow’s goals.
  6. Limit Distractions: Turn off notifications; avoid multitasking.
  7. Organize Visually: Use Obsidian as a “second brain” reference.
  8. Plan Extra Time: Buffer for complex tasks to avoid rushing.
  9. Weekly Review: Adjust goals based on progress and priorities.

Tip #

Incorporate one of these each day to build a strong, consistent planning habit.

Okay, let’s revise the plan, removing the theme selection and focusing on using AWS microservices:

I. Project Setup & Configuration

  1. Install Hugo: Download and install the Hugo static site generator. Follow the instructions for your operating system on the official Hugo website.
  2. Create a New Hugo Site: Use the Hugo CLI to create a new site: hugo new site your-site-name. This will create a basic directory structure for your Hugo project.
  3. Configure Hugo: Edit the config.toml (or config.yaml or config.json) file in the root of your Hugo project. Configure basic site settings like baseURL and title. Since we’re not using a theme, we’ll need to handle all styling ourselves. We’ll configure Hugo to output the bare minimum HTML structure.
  4. Set up Obsidian Vault: Create or designate an Obsidian vault to hold your website content.

II. Content Creation in Obsidian
